AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Pablo Road: location near where JORGE LUIS TREVINO initiated the stop, south of the wind farm on FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: road used as a smuggling route, with limited traffic and mostly used by local residents and workers, characterized by ranches and a wind farm
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. 59: highway with checkpoints that smugglers try to avoid, intersection location with Highway 16
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. 359: highway with checkpoints that smugglers try to avoid, connecting highway near Hebbronville checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16: highway that allows access to major highways going north, intersection with U.S. 59
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Antonio: destination for smuggled individuals, alternative route location
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Houston: destination for smuggled individuals, accessible via Highway 16
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.wind farm on FM 2050: location of windmills and wind farm office, between twelve and fifteen miles from the Freer immigration checkpoint on U.S. 59
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer immigration checkpoint: location where Agent Montemayor arrived to investigate an attempted alien smuggling event, near the intersection of Highway 16 and U.S. 59
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050 area: rural area characterized by ranches and a wind farm, with limited traffic, where vehicles with out-of-town registrations raised suspicions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico border: International boundary where roving Border Patrol stops are conducted, proximity to which is a factor in determining reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Southern District of Texas: judicial district with relevant case law regarding reasonable suspicion for Border Patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where defendants were indicted for transporting undocumented aliens, and country of citizenship claimed by the driver
